content.question: If <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a function that has a removable discontinuity at <math alttext="x equals 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>, which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 3 is indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers indicated on the y axis. The graph consists of two line segments. Two open circles and one closed circle are also included in the graph. The first line segment begins above the x axis, and to the left of the y axis. It moves downward and to the right, crosses the y axis above the origin, and ends at an open circle at x equals 3, just above the x axis. Directly above this open circle is a closed circle, and directly above the closed circle is a second open circle, high above the x axis. The second line segment begins at the second open circle, high above the x axis, and moves downward and to the right until it ends at a point above the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 3 is indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers indicated on the y axis. The graph consists of two line segments. One open circle and one closed circle are also included in the graph. The first line segment begins just above the x axis, and to the left of the y axis. It moves horizontally to the right, crosses the y axis above the origin, and ends at a closed circle at x equals 3, just above the x axis. Directly above this closed circle is an open circle, high above the x axis. The second line segment begins at the open circle, high above the x axis, and moves horizontally to the right until it ends at a point high above the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 3 is indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers indicated on the y axis. The graph consists of one line segment. One open circle and one closed circle are also included in the graph. The line segment begins below the x axis, and to the left of the y axis. It moves upward and to the right, crosses the y axis below the origin, and crosses the x axis at 1. It continues upward until it reaches an open circle at x equals 3, above the x axis. Directly below this open circle, but above the x axis, is a closed circle. The line segment begins again at the open circle, and continues upward and to the right until it ends at a point high above the x axis.

The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 3 is indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers indicated on the y axis. The graph consists of two curves. The first curve begins just below the x axis, and to the left of the x axis. It moves almost horizontally to the right initially, and crosses the y axis just below the origin. The curve becomes increasingly steep as it approaches x equals 3, where it is almost vertical and reaches the end of the visible portion of the plane. The second curve begins high above the x axis, just to the right of x equals 3, and moves almost vertically downward initially. The curve begins to level off as it approaches the x axis, and ends just above the x axis, far to the right of the origin.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The number 3 is indicated on the x axis. There are no numbers indicated on the y axis. The graph consists of one line segment. One open circle and one closed circle are also included in the graph. The line segment begins below the x axis, and to the left of the y axis. It moves upward and to the right, crosses the y axis below the origin, and crosses the x axis at 1. It continues upward until it reaches an open circle at x equals 3, above the x axis. Directly below this open circle, but above the x axis, is a closed circle. The line segment begins again at the open circle, and continues upward and to the right until it ends at a point high above the x axis.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
